intro: Tournefortiopsis crispiflora subsp. delicatula, commonly known as the delicate tournefortiopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
